name: USCoreMedicationRequestProfile
title: US Core MedicationRequest Profile
description: The US Core Medication Request Profile is based upon the core FHIR MedicationRequest Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 *Medications* requirements. The MedicationRequest resource can be used to record a patient's medication prescription or order.  This profile sets minimum expectations for the MedicationRequest resource to record, search, and fetch a patient's medication to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource and constrains the way the elements are used when using this profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: ORC-2-Placer Order Number / ORC-3-Filler Order Number

elements.name: status
elements.short: (USCDI) active | on-hold | cancelled | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | draft | unknown
elements.description: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally, this will be active or completed state.

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the prescribing event. Describes the lifecycle of the prescription.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: statusReason
elements.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.

binding.description: Identifies the reasons for a given status.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: intent
elements.short: (USCDI) proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
elements.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .moodCode (nuances beyond PRP/PLAN/RQO would need to be elsewhere)

elements.name: category
elements.description: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the category of medication request.  For example, where the medication is to be consumed or administered, or the type of medication treatment.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.description: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).

binding.description: The type of medication order. Note that other codes are permitted, see [Required Bindings When Slicing by Value Sets](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/general-requirements.html#required-bindings-when-slicing-by-valuesets)

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: priority
elements.description: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: doNotPerform
elements.short: True if request is prohibiting action
elements.description: If true indicates that the provider is asking for the medication request not to occur.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reported[x]
elements.description: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record.  It may also indicate the source of the report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: medication[x]
elements.description: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXE-2-Give Code / RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXC-2-Component Code

elements.name: subject
elements.short: (USCDI) Who or group medication request is for
elements.description: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Message/Body/NewRx/Patient(need detail to link to specific patient … Patient.Identification in SCRIPT)

elements.name: encounter
elements.short: (USCDI) Encounter created as part of encounter/admission/stay
elements.description: The Encounter during which this [x] was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .inboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].source[classCode=ENC, moodCode=EVN, code="type of encounter or episode"]

elements.name: supportingInformation
elements.short: Information to support ordering of the medication
elements.description: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=PERT].target[A_SupportingClinicalStatement CMET minimal with many different choices of classCodes(ORG, ENC, PROC, SPLY, SBADM, OBS) and each of the act class codes draws from one or more of the following moodCodes (EVN, DEF, INT PRMS, RQO, PRP, APT, ARQ, GOL)]

elements.name: authoredOn
elements.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXE-32-Original Order Date/Time / ORC-9-Date/Time of Transaction

elements.name: requester
elements.description: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performer
elements.description: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performerType
elements.short: Desired kind of performer of the medication administration
elements.description: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.

binding.description: Identifies the type of individual that is desired to administer the medication.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: recorder
elements.description: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.short: (USCDI) Reason or indication for ordering or not ordering the medication
elements.description: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: ORC-16-Order Control Code Reason /RXE-27-Give Indication/RXO-20-Indication / RXD-21-Indication / RXG-22-Indication / RXA-19-Indication

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.short: (USCDI) US Core Condition or Observation that supports the prescription
elements.description: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesCanonical
elements.description: The URL pointing to a protocol, guideline, orderset, or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesUri
elements.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: basedOn
elements.description: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=FLFS].target[classCode=SBADM or PROC or PCPR or OBS, moodCode=RQO orPLAN or PRP]

elements.name: groupIdentifier
elements.short: Composite request this is part of
elements.description: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: courseOfTherapyType
elements.description: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.

binding.description: Identifies the overall pattern of medication administratio.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Act.code where classCode = LIST and moodCode = EVN

elements.name: insurance
elements.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: note
elements.description: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: dosageInstruction
elements.short: (USCDI) How the medication should be taken
elements.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

elements.name: sequence
elements.short: The order of the dosage instructions
elements.description: Indicates the order in which the dosage instructions should be applied or interpreted.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: (USCDI) Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG
elements.description: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: additionalInstruction
elements.short: Supplemental instruction or warnings to the patient - e.g. "with meals", "may cause drowsiness"
elements.description: Supplemental instructions to the patient on how to take the medication  (e.g. "with meals" or"take half to one hour before food") or warnings for the patient about the medication (e.g. "may cause drowsiness" or "avoid exposure of skin to direct sunlight or sunlamps").

binding.description: A coded concept identifying additional instructions such as "take with water" or "avoid operating heavy machinery".

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: patientInstruction
elements.description: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

elements.name: timing
elements.description: When medication should be administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: asNeeded[x]
elements.description: Indicates whether the Medication is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule (Boolean option), or it indicates the precondition for taking the Medication (CodeableConcept).

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the precondition that should be met or evaluated prior to consuming or administering a medication dose.  For example "pain", "30 minutes prior to sexual intercourse", "on flare-up" etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=PRCN].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="as needed"].value=boolean or codable concept

elements.name: site
elements.description: Body site to administer to.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the site location the medicine enters into or onto the body.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: route
elements.description: How drug should enter body.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: method
elements.description: Technique for administering medication.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the technique by which the medicine is administered.

elements.description: The amount of medication administered.

elements.name: dispenseRequest
elements.description: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order).  Note that this information is not always sent with the order.  There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

elements.name: quantity
elements.description: The amount or quantity to provide as part of the first dispense.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: duration
elements.description: The length of time that the first dispense is expected to last.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: dispenseInterval
elements.short: Minimum period of time between dispenses
elements.description: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: validityPeriod
elements.short: Time period supply is authorized for
elements.description: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
elements.description: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.  A prescriber may explicitly say that zero refills are permitted after the initial dispense.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: quantity
elements.short: (USCDI) Amount of medication to supply per dispense
elements.description: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

elements.name: expectedSupplyDuration
elements.short: Number of days supply per dispense
elements.description: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performer
elements.description: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: substitution
elements.description: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

elements.name: allowed[x]
elements.short: Whether substitution is allowed or not
elements.description: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

binding.description: Identifies the type of substitution allowed.
